intro: Platypetalum, commonly known as the false hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plants typically feature showy, five-petaled flowers that are often brightly colored, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. They have simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptical in shape. Platypetalum species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
